page.title: 06Farming(1) in Leverton
page.content: Much of the land in our village is used for farming,particularly arable farming.The soil is very rich silt and can usually produce two crops per year especially of "greens",cabbage(spring and hard white) and cauliflowers.The other main crops grown are potatoes, sprouts,sugar beet,peas and beans and cereals especially wheat and barley. Soft fruit is no longer commercially grown but many people grow a small amount for their own use.Grass land for grazing is now very scarce being restricted to about 50 or so acres. In the past many of the village people were employed working on the land but modern implements and greater mechanization means fewer people are now employed to produce far more food. Greater mechanization also means larger fields and fewer hedges and trees for the wildlife.
